page.title: 13HIGHNAM CHURCH
page.content: Holy Innocents Church,Highnam was built in 1847-51,part of the extensive building and restoration work connected with the Oxford Movement.It was built for Thomas Gambier-Parry who developed a paint for,and carried out, the internal wall paintings.The large church is set in the park of Highnam Court,its west tower and spire visible for some distance as a landmark.The style is Decorated,the interior perhaps dim.The stained glass windows depict nine scenes from the Life of Christ. Close to the church are a lodge, school and vicarage of similar date. The school opened in 1850 and continued until the move to a new building in 1981.
